Message.Msg: No longer has monopoly in a lot of it's business areas. Everyone looking for more revenue, Amazon's various businesses will be attacked from old school companies and tech alike. Taxes, and more taxes.

Topic.Title: My hat is off to all those longs from late 90s and early 2000s but AMZN's string of good fortune is over, time to short it

Message.Msg: Why buy into a company that has no major earnings is beyond me. The only reason longs are buying, in addition to ignorant longs who follow hypes, is the dream of potential AMZN revenue expansion. Needless to say, they have revenue growth alright, but their business is awfully expensive to run as well. Therefore, resulting in declining YOY profits. Suck to be long, in my opinion, they are trapped in a perpetual wet dream of this POS will go higher in order to save their butts.

Topic.Title: My hat is off to all those longs from late 90s and early 2000s but AMZN's string of good fortune is over, time to short it

Message.Msg: They have had free reign to do willy nilly for two decades. That is over. Ebay is after their business Apple and Google is after their business. Netflix is a good competitor in streaming, and who knows who else will go into that area. And as far as cloud, everyone and their mother is in that business too. And when AMZN enters the tablet business, what do they do but sell them at a loss.

Topic.Title: 90 Days Ago

Message.Msg: No worry, Amazon is built for the future. LOL.

Topic.Title: senate approved internet tax...amazon margin to go from bad to pitiful

Message.Msg: Supposedly they supported this with their distribution center model. Let's face it unless their non retail businesses really take off and deliver they are F-ed. More and more brick and mortars are doing more on-line and the idea that people will simply be loyal to Amazon if they start increasing prices, in an economy that is so-so at best but really only good because of the propped up stock market, is not a good investment thesis. Growth is slowing and in many of their tech businesses AMZN is stepping in with the big boys who, by the way, are mostly not valued to the moon (I don't count NFLX, I said big boys, not fellow scam stock). When growth slows and you are still investing in the future and bearing little fruit, gravity most assuredly will be taking over.

Topic.Title: senate approved internet tax...amazon margin to go from bad to pitiful

Message.Msg: It would probably have been better if the tax did not pass. AMZN is expanding into all the states, so they would have had to pay sales tax anyway. If sales tax did not pass, AMZN would have faced a ton of online retailers doing what they did - undercut the competition through the sales tax advantage. Either way though, AMZN is in for a rude awakening. Retailers with existing distribution foot print in place are getting better at managing their logistics - for example, fulfilling online orders using the inventory of the stores nearest you. Existing major and mega retailers will able to fulfill orders faster and with less cost than AMZN.

Message.Title: Additional costs imposed and competitive advantage deeply impaired
Message.Msg: with the passage of internet sales task....and no, this is not priced in. the market in AMZN is inefficient

Message.Msg: Should shave a couple % off that revenue growth projection. With no profit to show for, it's a dog at this valuation. Bag holders are very scared at this point but they should have known that the day is coming when amazon looses it edge (loop hole). Now that the bounce is over, the next leg down is imminent. IMO, most stock market profits and assets are being held by the 1%, I can't imagine how much of that will make it down to the everyday economy. These stock market (hmm paper wealth) is so damning, it will looses a lot of value as soon as someone headed toward the exit, so right now they are trying to pump for mom and pop 401k but since so much wealth has been destroyed (hmm transferred) in the last few years. It's getting hard to repeat the same trick twice so soon. That is why Ben has been the de factor savior of this economy. Very pathetic.

Topic.Title: This bill being approved might make the stock get bid up because...

Message.Msg: That's actually true. Amazon's goal is to be the worlds #1 online retailer. They define this as by conducting the most business dollarwise. (In my opinion, profits should factor into this equation somewhere, but that is besides the point). This is going to hurt margins across the board. Squeeze out other online retailers. AMZN doesn't care how much money it loses or never makes, it just wants to be number one and crush competition anyway and anywhere it can.

Topic.Title: This bill being approved might make the stock get bid up because...

Message.Msg: Nah...AMZN the stock will go down. AMZN simply cannot sustain the level of growth rate required to main its current valuation. AMZN supports the sales tax because they don't want someone to come along and did what they did - destroy local economies through an unfair advantage. That said, AMZN still faces formidable and entrenched competitors with deep pockets. Do note that their competitors are profitable business with a razor sharp focus. Unlike AMZN, they don't chase every shiny new ball to mask losses an inability to compete on a level play field.
